support.rs: Painted on a plastered wall surface. Poorly preserved.
Naos, northeast pier, west face, lower register

layoutDesc.layout: Below the mural, which was deliberately destroyed probably in medieval times.

handDesc.handNote: White majuscule letters against blue background. Mu with the central strokes reminiscent of an upsilon on a crossed stem; xi with upper part with a straight diagonal spine, and lower part with a curvilinear spine; top bar with serif to the left. Οmega with its apex surmounted by a crosslet, formed of two linked oval bowls, each bearing an inward-curving spine. ΟΥ joined in ligature. Systematic use of triangular serifs. Lines are ruled top and bottom. Accents and breathings systematic. Letter height: 5

origin.origPlace: Koutsoventis, Monastery of Saint John Chrysostom, Holy Trinity chapel

history.provenance: Not accessible; located in a Turkish military zone in occupied north Cyprus. Studied and photographed in 1969.
